intro: Arcytophyllum rivetii, commonly known as the Tibetan sandthorn, is a shrub native to the high altitudes of the Tibetan Plateau. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper species. The plant is characterized by its small, scale-like leaves and produces yellowish-orange cones. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or rocky soils. Due to its hardy nature, it plays a vital role in stabilizing soil in its native habitat.
